document_data.name: Booter
document_data.mainbody:
'''Booter''' was the dungeon master and the "official torturer" of the [[Shadow Thieves]] in [[Amn]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Now, what's all th bloody noise about? It's not like I'm goin' to remove the red-hot [[fire poker|poker]] simply cause you start pleadin' for mercy, now, is it? Now, now, ye should have thought about that before you went and murdered your guild partners and their families. Now careful, your moving might cause real damage here, an' then where would I be? Tsk. I don't think you really appreciate the level of craftsmanship you're receiving here. We've been at this for, what? Four days? And you've only passed out twice.''|Booter}}
document_data.Description: Booter was a [[gnome|gnomish]]<ref group="note">The novel erroneously depicts Booter as a [[human]] and as the jailer of [[Jon Irenicus]]'s. However, the ''Baldur's Gate'' novels are considered non-canon; as such, the game lore takes precedence. man with an untidy, uneven beard and a single yellow tooth.
document_data.Possessions: Booter was adorned in [[leather armor]], sometimes preferring a set of [[studded leather]]s instead. He carried an [[enchanted]] ''+1'' [[flail]], a small [[shield]], and had an enchanted ''+2'' [[greatsword]] at the ready.
document_data.History: By the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, Booter was a well-respected member of the Shadow Thieves who manned the guild's torture chambers in [[Aran Linvail]]'s hideout located in the [[Athkatla/Wave District|Wave District]]'s docks. He considered himself to be an artisan and master of his craft â€“ the gnome's pride and joy. At the time, Booter's apprentice was a youth named [[Douglas]] who passed the torturer pliers, saws, and other instruments of information extraction.
